While my Duna experiment ship is on his 76-day trip, I want to do something else other than wait/time warp, so the project 'study the Mun inside out' started.

While repeat experiments on orbit of mun, I found that I don't know the exact altitude for 'near space' and 'outer space', few tests shows that any orbit under 50km is treat as 'near space', trying to find outer space currently.

My question is, how to tell the exact altitude for 'lower atmosphere', 'upper atmosphere', 'near space' and 'outer space' of a certain planet? Is there anyway to found it ingame?

Edited October 22, 2013 by SaturnV

I think that someone has already found out the data here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/53567-List-of-places-and-biomes-in-v0-22-%28Kerbal-planetary-geology-and-geography%29

But the best way to find out is to keep testing and trimming it down until you find the limits, FOR SCIENCE!
